articles.author: Enrico de Lazaro
articles.title: 36,500-Year-Old Human Genomes from Crimea Shed New Light on First Europeans - Sci.News
articles.description: In a new study, scientists sequenced and analyzed the genomes of two 36,000-37,000-year-old individuals from the site of Buran-Kaya III in Crimea, Ukraine.
articles.content: Populations genetically related to present-day Europeans first appeared in Europe at some point after 38,000-40,000 years ago, following a cold period of severe climatic disruption. These new migrant… [+3490 chars]
